symptoms.name: Epibulbar and tarsal hemorrhages
symptoms.pattern: Present within 48 hours in >90% of AHC cases

symptoms.name: Precervical lymph node enlargement
symptoms.pattern: May be present in acute hemorrhagic conjunctivitis

symptoms.name: Corneal infiltrates
symptoms.severity: Variable, may cause decreased visual acuity
symptoms.pattern: Multifocal, non-vascularized, centrally located, nummular; appear after a few days in 95% of cases

symptoms.name: Conjunctival scarring and symblepharon
symptoms.pattern: May occur with membranous or pseudomembranous conjunctivitis

physical_findings: Tarsal pseudomembranes (in acute fulminant disease or immunodeficiency)
risk_factors: Contact with infected surfaces or objects
Inadequate hand washing by healthcare personnel
Improper use of dropper bottles and vials
Crowded environments with low personal hygiene

required: Clinical presentation consistent with adenoviral keratoconjunctivitis (symptoms and physical findings)
supportive: Positive adenovirus detection by PCR, cell culture, or immunoassay (e.g., AdenoPlus)
